statement.text: Max Planck introduced natural units in 1899, one year before his famous blackbody radiation paper. He recognized that combining the fundamental constants G, ℏ (then h), and c yields unique units of length, time, and mass that are 'independent of any arbitrary choice of bodies or substances' - universal constants that would be recognized by any civilization in the universe.
statement.motivation: To find units that transcend anthropocentric choices

explanation.intuition: Before Planck, all units were based on arbitrary human choices: the meter from Earth's circumference, the second from Earth's rotation, the kilogram from water density. Planck realized that three fundamental constants - G (gravity), c (light speed), and h (action quantum) - could be combined to create length, time, and mass units that are truly universal. Any intelligent beings, anywhere in the universe, measuring these constants would derive the same Planck units.
explanation.key_insight: Planck's genius was recognizing that the constants G, c, and h are not just parameters in equations but define absolute scales of nature. He wrote: 'These units retain their meaning as long as the law of gravitation and the velocity of light and the two principles of thermodynamics remain valid.' This was decades before quantum gravity - Planck intuited that these scales would be fundamental.
explanation.historical_context: When Planck introduced these units in 1899, quantum mechanics didn't exist (his blackbody paper was 1900). General relativity was 16 years away (1915). The idea that these scales represent quantum gravity was not understood until much later - yet Planck somehow chose exactly the right constants.

planck_original_values.note: Planck used h, not ℏ = h/(2π); values updated to modern precision

temperature.note: Added later when Boltzmann constant k_B included

planck_quote.original_german: Diese Größen behalten ihre natürliche Bedeutung so lange, als die Gesetze der Gravitation, der Lichtfortpflanzung im Vakuum und die beiden Hauptsätze der Wärmetheorie in Gültigkeit bleiben
planck_quote.english_translation: These quantities retain their natural significance as long as the laws of gravitation, the propagation of light in a vacuum, and the two principles of thermodynamics remain valid
planck_quote.significance: Planck understood these were the most fundamental scales in physics

why_planck_chose_these_constants.h: Quantum of action - minimum 'uncertainty' in nature

learning_objectives: Understand Planck's original motivation for natural units
Appreciate that Planck units predate quantum mechanics and GR
Recognize the universality argument: any civilization would find same units
Trace historical development from 1899 to modern quantum gravity
physics_insights: Planck introduced these units in 1899 - BEFORE quantum mechanics!
G, c, h uniquely determine ℓ_P, t_P, m_P through dimensional analysis
Planck's quote: valid 'as long as laws of gravitation and thermodynamics remain valid'
Modern significance not understood until Wheeler, Bekenstein, Hawking in 1950s-70s
